intro: Androsace rhizomatosa var. major, commonly known as the Greater Alpina, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are generally oval to lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. This species thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments.
